src:
BRD, a treia bancă după active, a încheiat primele nouă luni cu un profit net de 1,2 mld.lei, în creştere cu 11%, la venituri bancare de 2,3 mld.lei, în urcare cu 8,5%
06 Nov 2019, 07:16 by Roxana Rosu
BRD SocGen (simbol bursier - BRD), a treia cea mai mare instituţie de credit locală după active, a înregistrat în primele nouă luni ale anului venituri nete bancare de 2,39 miliarde lei, în creştere cu 8,5%, şi un profit net de 1,2 miliarde lei, cu 11% peste nivelul din perioada similară a anului trecut, potrivit raportului financiar al băncii.
“Primele noua luni ale anului 2019 au fost dinamice din punct de vedere comercial. Prin intensificarea creditarii atat pe segmentul retail, cat si pe cel corporate, ne-am pastrat angajamentul de finantare a economiei romanesti in mod responsabil, printr-o oferta imbunatatita si echilibrata. Evolutia activitatii pe piata fondurilor mutuale a fost, de asemenea, remarcabila, in linie cu strategia noastra de a surprinde potentialul pietei solutiilor alternative de economisire. In acelasi timp, am continuat implementarea modelului nostru de afaceri "phygital", ce combina experienta digitala superioara si expertiza umana”, a declarat Francois Bloch, Director General al BRD Groupe Societe Generale.
Portofoliul total de credite s-a majorat la finele lunii septembrie cu 2,9%, la 29 miliarde lei, în timp ce depozitele totalizau 44 miliarde lei, în urcare cu 0,9%.
La nivelul Grupului BRD, veniturile nete s-au majorat cu 6,9%, la 2,44 miliarde lei, iar profitul net cu 7,4%, la 1,2 miliarde lei.
text:
BRD, the third bank by assets, ended the first nine months with a net profit of 1.2 billion lei, up 11%, on bank revenues of 2.3 billion lei, up 8.5%
06 Nov 2019, 07:16 by Roxana Rosu
BRD SocGen (stock exchange symbol - BRD), the third largest local credit institution by assets, recorded in the first nine months of the year net banking revenues of 2.39 billion lei, increasing by 8.5%, and a profit net of 1.2 billion lei, 11% above the level of the similar period of last year, according to the financial report of the bank.
“The first nine months of 2019 were commercially dynamic. By increasing lending on both the retail and corporate segments, we have kept our commitment to finance the Romanian economy responsibly, through an improved and balanced offer. The evolution of the activity on the market of mutual funds was also remarkable, in line with our strategy to capture the market potential of alternative saving solutions. At the same time, we have continued the implementation of our "phygital" business model, which combines superior digital experience and human expertise, "said Francois Bloch, General Manager of BRD Groupe Societe Generale.
The total loan portfolio increased at the end of September by 2.9%, to 29 billion lei, while deposits totaled 44 billion lei, up 0.9%.
At the BRD Group level, net revenues increased by 6.9%, to 2.44 billion lei, and net profit by 7.4%, to 1.2 billion lei.
